description: This Dart source file defines the Board class for a 2048 puzzle game. It includes methods for managing the game grid, placing and removing tiles, moving tiles, merging tiles, spawning new tiles, and checking game state conditions.

classes.name: Board
classes.description: Represents the game board for 2048, implementing the game logic such as tile placement, movement, merging, and game state queries.

methods.name: Board.empty
methods.description: Creates an empty 4x4 board with all cells null, optionally specifying the starting tile ID.

methods.name: Board.fromGrid
methods.description: Creates a new Board instance from an existing grid with a specified next tile ID.

methods.name: placeTile
methods.description: Returns a new Board with the specified tile placed at its row and column.

methods.name: removeAt
methods.description: Returns a new Board with the cell at the specified row and column cleared.

methods.name: getAt
methods.description: Retrieves the tile at the specified position, or null if empty.

methods.name: emptyCells
methods.description: Returns a list of coordinates (as Points) of all empty cells.

methods.name: hasEmpty
methods.description: Checks if there is at least one empty cell on the board.

methods.name: containsValue
methods.description: Checks if a tile with the specified value exists on the board.

methods.name: maxTile
methods.description: Finds and returns the highest tile value present on the board.

methods.name: withTileMoved
methods.description: Returns a new Board with a specified tile moved to a new position.

methods.name: replaceTwoWithMerged
methods.description: Returns a new Board where two tiles merge into a new tile at a specified position.

methods.name: spawnAt
methods.description: Spawns a new tile with specified value at a given position, assigning a new ID.

methods.name: cloneGrid
methods.description: Creates a deep copy of the grid array.

methods.name: hasAnyMove
methods.description: Determines if any move is possible, i.e., if the game can continue.
